channel.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] How to make a very simple WebBrowser
channel.description:
To Start off. Please just dont copy+paste code. it dosent really help you learn.
Ok
[b]Step 1:[/b] First create a new stranded exe document.
resize it to your liking :)
Now make 4 command buttons.
change the captions and the names accordingly
cmdBack = Back. cmdForward = Forward. cmdHome = Home. cmdStop = Stop.
and if you want you can make one more.
cmdSearch = Search.
[b]Step 2:[/b] Open Visual Basic, and Press CTRL+T or go to the Project Menu -> Components. When the Components dialog pops-up scroll down to the Microsoft Internet Controls in the Controls section, select it and press OK. [img]http://www.acky.net/tutorials/vb/wbrowser/pic1.gif[/img]
You should now see a globe on your toolbox now. if not repeat step 2 and read it more carefully.
[b]Step 3:[/b] Create one label and name it: lbCaption Create one combo box control and name it: cboURL and with the web browser control you've just added, and name it: wWeb
mess around with it and now it should turn out like this: [URL=http://img240.imageshack.us/my.php?image=tutorialpb3.png][IMG]http://img240.imageshack.us/img240/2600/tutorialpb3.png[/img][/URL]
[b]Step 4:[/b] Now that you've finished the UI [User Interface] for your web browser, here comes the easy/hard yet fun part of making your browser! The coding :) , you have to write codes for your browser to function properly.
Double Click cmdBack then type this code in: [code]wweb.GoBack [/code] the GoBack method makes the web browser control to go back to the previous page.
Double Click cmdForward then type this code in: [code]wWeb.GoForward[/code] The GoForward method makes the web browser control to go forward to another page.
Double Click cmdStop then type this code in: [code]wWeb.Stop[/code] The Stop method makes the web browser control stop whatever it's doing.
Double Click cmdHome then type this code in: [code] wWeb.GoHome [/code] The Home method makes your web browser control navigate back to the webpage that you set as home in the Internet Explorer Option.
Then Right click anywhere on your form then click view code and put this in at the bottom: [code] cboURL_KeyDown() If KeyCode = vbKeyReturn Then wWeb.Navigate cboURL.Text End If[/code] That code will make the web browser control navigate to the URL you that you specified in the cboURL whenever you press the return key while typing in the combo box.
[b]Step 5:[/b] COMPLETED!
Now spice up your browser with some images. place everything in the right place and release it...
If you liked my tut please post your results and sign up on myself & chris & gordey0's forum www.lagex.net.
At the end. it looks like this:
[URL=http://img240.imageshack.us/my.php?image=tutorial2pm2.png][IMG]http://img240.imageshack.us/img240/847/tutorial2pm2.png[/img][/URL]

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“happy_world, post:10, topic:59005”]why don’t you make an excellant web browser even better then internet exporer and firefox.
this is not a compation between devull and wonderguy6 who makes a web browser with more featuers. wonderguy6 made an excellant tuturial. if he put in his tutorial more featuers people will not be able to do it or would be lasy to do it. tanks for the tuturial Wonderguy6 (even i done my own web browser last year but i didn’t make a tutrial like you)[/quote]

Do you think it’s that easy to make a better webbrowser than IE or FF?

And wonderguy, I cba to read through your post. Does use IE to parse HTML?

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] How to make a very simple WebBrowser
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

To Start off. Please just dont copy+paste code. it dosent really help you learn.

Ok

Step 1:
First create a new stranded exe document.

resize it to your liking

Now make 4 command buttons.

change the captions and the names accordingly

cmdBack = Back.
cmdForward = Forward.
cmdHome = Home.
cmdStop = Stop.

and if you want you can make one more.

cmdSearch = Search.

Step 2:
Open Visual Basic, and Press CTRL+T or go to the Project Menu -> Components. When the Components dialog pops-up scroll down to the Microsoft Internet Controls in the Controls section, select it and press OK.

You should now see a globe on your toolbox now. if not repeat step 2 and read it more carefully.

Step 3:
Create one label and name it: lbCaption
Create one combo box control and name it: cboURL
and with the web browser control you’ve just added, and name it: wWeb

mess around with it and now it should turn out like this:

Step 4:
Now that you’ve finished the UI [User Interface] for your web browser, here comes the easy/hard yet fun part of making your browser! The coding , you have to write codes for your browser to function properly.

Double Click cmdBack then type this code in:

wweb.GoBack

the GoBack method makes the web browser control to go back to the previous page.

Double Click cmdForward then type this code in:

wWeb.GoForward

The GoForward method makes the web browser control to go forward to another page.

Double Click cmdStop then type this code in:

wWeb.Stop

The Stop method makes the web browser control stop whatever it’s doing.

Double Click cmdHome then type this code in:

 wWeb.GoHome

The Home method makes your web browser control navigate back to the webpage that you set as home in the Internet Explorer Option.

Then Right click anywhere on your form then click view code and put this in at the bottom:

cboURL_KeyDown() If KeyCode = vbKeyReturn Then wWeb.Navigate cboURL.Text End If
That code will make the web browser control navigate to the URL you that you specified in the cboURL whenever you press the return key while typing in the combo box.

Step 5:
COMPLETED!

Now spice up your browser with some images. place everything in the right place and release it…

If you liked my tut please post your results and sign up on myself & chris & gordey0’s forum www.lagex.net.

At the end. it looks like this:
